page.title: 17ECOLOGY-1
page.content: The area is divided into distinct areas; downland, woodland, water meadows and roughland. The plant and animal life in each area has a character of its own. {1.DOWNLAND}Here on the chalk downland the grass is short and coarse. Few trees grow except stunted hawthorn, used mainly for hedging. In the spring cowslips can be seen but these are not as common as they were. In the spring cowslips can be seen but these are not as common as they were. A decade ago the downs were a mass of yellow in April and May, now however, they are quite difficult to see. In the summer the sharp eyed walker can occasionally spot a bee orchid, but these are now very few and far between.
